27 minutes ago, Gargamel said:

This only happens if you are on Page N of a thread, and your next post would be the first post on page N+1 (ie your﻿﻿﻿ post ﻿starts a new page), as yours seems to ﻿be ﻿here. ﻿

But if I've counted correctly, it's actually this post which will start a new page

Edit: and of course, it works fine this time

Edited July 5, 2019 by 4x4cheesecake

On 7/4/2019 at 11:15 PM, 4x4cheesecake said:
Looks like we lost
the ability to change
the bordercolor of a
table  

 

Dunno what you're talking about

Edited July 18, 2019 by Geonovast

29 minutes ago, Geonovast said:

Dunno what you're talking about

Would you mind to explain it to me how you did this? I know this was possible by editing the HTML code for the table but this method doesn't work for me anymore (the bordercolor will change in the editor but reverts to black after submitting the post). Maybe browser related? I'm using the latest firefox (68.0).

I'll try it one more time, just to be sure:

   
   
   

edit: nope...

edit2: odd, it works now...

Edited July 18, 2019 by 4x4cheesecake

@4x4cheesecake I did with editing the html in the inspector.

<table style="style="width:500px;border-color:#FF0000;border-width:14px;border-style:inset;">

and each <td style="border-color:#FF0000;">

 

Hopefully it won't try to parse those...

Edit: nope!

Edited July 18, 2019 by Geonovast

4 minutes ago, Geonovast said:

I did with editing the html in the inspector.

<table style="style="width:500px;border-color:#FF0000;border-width:14px;border-style:inset;"﻿>

and each <td style="border-color:#FF0000;"﻿﻿>

Interesting...it works when I copy the table style from your post, which also contains quite a few different parameters, not just the additional border color. This will require a few more tests but it's good to know, it is still possible

Thanks
